html.xhtml:p: Id of human subject of this Entry, e.g.:
• subject of record (patient, etc.)
• organ donor
• foetus
• a family member
• another clinically relevant person.

notes.plain: Id of human subject of this Entry, e.g.: • subject of record (patient, etc.) • organ donor • foetus • a family member • another clinically relevant person.

html.xhtml:p: Optional identification of the source of the information in this Entry, which might be:
• the patient
• a patient agent, e.g. parent, guardian
• the clinician
• a device or software

notes.plain: Optional identification of the source of the information in this Entry, which might be: • the patient • a patient agent, e.g. parent, guardian • the clinician • a device or software

html.xhtml:p: List of other participations at Entry level.

notes.plain: List of other participations at Entry level.

html.xhtml:p: Optional external identifier of protocol used to create this Entry. This could be a clinical guideline, an operations protocol,etc.

notes.plain: Optional external identifier of protocol used to create this Entry. This could be a clinical guideline, an operations protocol,etc.

html.xhtml:p: Identifier of externally held workflow engine (state machine) data for this workflow execution.

notes.plain: Identifier of externally held workflow engine (state machine) data for this workflow execution.
Audit trail from the system of original commit of information forming the content of this node, or from a conversion gateway which has synthesised this node.

html.xhtml:p: Audit trail from the system of original commit of information forming the content of this node, or from a conversion gateway which has synthesised this node.

xhtml:p.xhtml:span: Mandatory indicator of the localised language in which this Entry is written. The value space of language is the set of all strings that are valid language identifiers as defined [RFC 3066].

notes.plain: Mandatory indicator of the localised language in which this Entry is written. The value space of language is the set of all strings that are valid language identifiers as defined [RFC 3066].
Optional link(s) to other Locatable structures.

xhtml:p.xhtml:span: Optional link(s) to other Locatable structures.

html.xhtml:p: Descriptive name of this datatype model. Provides the semantic 'name' for the model. Replaces what would be XML element name or class name in conventional modeling.

notes.plain: Descriptive name of this datatype model. Provides the semantic 'name' for the model. Replaces what would be XML element name or class name in conventional modeling.

html.xhtml:p: Name of character set encoding in which text values in this Entry are encoded. Default is utf-8.

notes.plain: Name of character set encoding in which text values in this Entry are encoded. Default is utf-8.

html.xhtml:p: The current state according to the state machine / workflow engine identified in the workflow element.

notes.plain: The current state according to the state machine / workflow engine identified in the workflow element.

html.xhtml:p: The data structure of the Entry. There is not an element named 'data' in the implementation. The RM references an ItemType and in a DM this is substituted with a one of the two ItemTypes elements.

notes.plain: The data structure of the Entry. There is not an element named 'data' in the implementation. The RM references an ItemType and in a DM this is substituted with a one of the two ItemTypes elements.

html.xhtml:p: An Entry is the root of a logical set of data items.

notes.plain: An Entry is the root of a logical set of data items.

xhtml:p.xhtml:span: This is the root node of a Data Model (DM).
You may name the file anything you wish as long as you maintain the Xmind ( .xmind ) extension.
After saving the file; create your concept definition by copying the appropriate components from the sheets.

notes.plain:
This is the root node of a Data Model (DM). You may name the file anything you wish as long as you maintain the Xmind ( .xmind ) extension.
After saving the file; create your concept definition by copying the appropriate components from the sheets.
